metadata.name: Until biodiversity rains #98
metadata.description:
Audiovisual generative artwork. 

In the interpretation of biological organisms, which break paradigms by doing something different, to adapt to changes and be able to survive, paths emerge to be imitated by so many, and make life flow. The development of the work is a metaphor for those paths full of ingenuity and risk, where colorful organisms in rows open trails, sliding like subtle drops, with sophisticated turns and elastic jumps.

Some alternative paths usually hide a message along the way. Literally, one could find and read phrases in relation to biodiversity and its importance. Although it is more common to ignore them, sometimes not respect them, or what is worse, forget them. Even so, in an exacerbated insistence, here, audiovisual organizations seem to be repeating themselves, “until biodiversity rains”, and variety exploits so that ecosystems finally go it alone.


Relationship between visuals and sounds:
Biological organisms of different colors follow a path. They move forward, change shape, stop, turn. Always one after the other. At certain moments, they stretch and jump and sounds emerge.

Towards the edges of the canvas, the jumps are translated into cello sounds, mainly pizzicatos. Towards the center, the piano. From the main jumps emerges a kind of melody played by a pseudo-theremin-synth, characterized by flyaway melodies with glissant.


This artwork is 100% code, made in p5.js + tone.js.

[ Click ]  -> sound ON / OFF
[ s ] -> save 2160x2160px (in live view)
[ f ] -> fullscreen
[ p ] -> pause / play 

Note: This artwork is an animated piece, and requires a powerful GPU for optimal real-time playback. It is important to note that it may not run properly on mobile devices, especially not high-end ones.
It is recommended to run the piece in a new window from the “open” button.

attributes.name: hidden message
attributes.value: El uso apropiado de la ciencia no es conquistar la naturaleza, sino vivir en ella. (Barry Commoner)

metadata.name: BINGO #417
metadata.description: Bingo is a series of 500 random generated "bingo" cards, language unknown

metadata.name: Aspergo #10
metadata.description:
A practice on texturing abstract paintings. Up to three techniques are applied by the painter to compose each image.

It may take a bit to start/finish depending on the features and cpu power, in any case i recommend to sit back and enjoy the painting process.

Press 's' in live mode to save a high resolution PNG

Created with p5.js
dmarchi, 2022

metadata.name: Bravura #131
metadata.description:
Different techniques over seven layers of digital pigments combined to build a bold abstract painting.

More information can be found in the console.

Here is an overview of its features:
https://dmarchi.xyz/bravura/features

High resolution files available at:
https://dmarchi.xyz/bravura


Created with p5.js
dmarchi, 2022

metadata.name: Symbolic Separations #64
metadata.description:
Is this a metaphor for the unstable process of division? Or colours and shapes morphing and inverting along imaginary, fluxing and blurred boundaries?

At least we know it's two passes through two different GLSL shaders, where waves are blurred, turbulence accumulated, and lines drawn to flip colors.

## Controls

Press [spacebar] to toggle play/pause.

When paused, press the keys [1] through [4] to change the resolution.

[1] - 2400px x 2400px

[2] - 3600px x 3600px

[3] - 4800px x 4800px

[4] - 5400px x 5400px

Then (also only when paused) press [p] to create a hi-res PNG.

metadata.name: Observers #59
metadata.description: Artwork by x0y0z0 @x0y0z0tn (2021)

metadata.name: Life has no scores #104
metadata.description:
We cannot compose life, at best we hum along to the melodies that life has been played in front of us. Looking back at the scores of our lives, the notations are never neatly noted, but fully felt.  Rewinding the songs of life are our memories, whether sad, happy, angry, or melancholy. It is not clear whether I am dreaming or awake, but our songs all do end. 

In this final drop (for ?), I have reused the first ever class calligraphy(){} I have written from my genesis drop “Nothing comes from nothing”. As time passes, 10 drops later, across almost to the year, I am grateful for the progress I have made, as an artist, and more importantly as a human. After all, what is behind the code of generative art is a human being. 

Scores of music, scrolls of calligraphy, calendar or diary, notating life, time passes, and changes are inevitable. Sometimes we sing louder in laughter and joy, sometimes we scribble in uneasiness, sometimes we just get lost in neon lights. Life goes on. You and me, all the same and yet different.  

There are too many friend artists, friend collectors, fxhash team members, to thank for helping me through this journey. I would like to pay homage to Rudxane in this work, who has taken me under his wings, mentoring and encouraging me in art as well as showing me some degen stuff on the side:-). This homage is not copy-minting, or copying of styles, which I do not have the coding skills to do so even if I wanted to. But it is the influence of taste in many works of Rudxane. In a vague but agreeable taste, I present to you Life has no scores. 

What I was taught was disrupted, and grid studies left unfinished, and oh do we have a BINGO?

Tested on Chrome. Other browsers may render different or not at all (firefox)

Press ‘2’ to save png.

Copyright (©) 2022 Jimi Wen
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Proto alphabet #99
metadata.description:
For more than 4000 years, before Lineal A in Crete, proto alphabets were created. They freed man from the chains of evolution and gave a way to record the rhythm of the passage of time.

As recursion generates a grammar, recursion generates the strokes that shape the following proto alphabets, which attempt to record the passage of time.

Time is the substance I am made of. Time is a river which sweeps me along, but I am the river; it is a tiger which destroys me, but I am the tiger; it is a fire which consumes me, but I am the fire. - Jorge Luis Borges


Desde hace más de 4000 años, antes Lineal A en Creta, proto alfabetos fueron creados. Liberaron al hombre de las cadenas de la evolución y dieron una forma para registrar el ritmo del paso del tiempo.

Como la recursividad genera una gramática, la recursividad genera los trazos que dan forma a los siguientes proto alfabetos, los cuales intentan registrar el paso del tiempo.

El tiempo es la sustancia de que estoy hecho. El tiempo es un río que me arrebata, pero yo soy el río; es un tigre que me destroza, pero yo soy el tigre; es un fuego que me consume, pero yo soy el fuego. - Jorge Luis Borges


Controls (in live view):
- Press s to get a PNG file
- Press S to get a SVG file

Artwork by x0y0z0 @x0y0z0tn (2023)

Un souffle peint des formes parfaits.
L’espace frémit, l’air est troublé,
Né d’un mirage, le blob moiré.

metadata.name: Platonics #65
metadata.description:
A response to being buffeted by forces outside of our control. Platonics sought to find order, control and solace in the Platonic solids. Instead it found beauty and intrigue in the emergent chaos that can arise from even the simplest systems.

Its building blocks are the five Platonic solids. Forms which have fascinated humanity for thousands of years. Their title comes from the philosophy of Plato, who equated each of the solids with a classical element.

Platonics arranges these forms in a series of geometric layouts, with varying density and randomness. At one extreme we see tidy radial circles consisting of a single solid. At the other, packed pentagons consisting of jumbled solids give rise to Escher-esque compositions which hold near infinite variety, variety enhanced by a range of pens and colours that draw and fill those solids.

This relationship between order and disorder is at the heart of Platonics. The collection seeks to show how they are not so far removed from one another – and how we might embrace them both. It also aims to give collectors a behind the scenes look at how generative compositions can be constructed.

The geometric proof that there are only five convex regular polyhedra (the Platonic solids) states that at each vertex of the solid the angles between adjacent sides must be less than 360 degrees. This amount less than 360 degrees is known as the defect angle.

It is from this geometric proof that the collection size and pricing for Platonics is derived. There will be 360 Platonics sold via a Dutch auction priced according to the defect angles of the five Platonic solids: 180 > 120 > 90 > 60 > 36.

https://www.phaust.art/platonics

----------

Competition: Submit your favourite previews via Twitter to win a free mint and print.

Prints: Free gallery-grade, signed A3 prints for the first 18 mints.

Live: Press ‘S’ to save in hi-res or append '&size=#' to the URL for custom height.

Info: Original artwork by Phaust. Winter 2023. London / Brighton. Made with p5js.

attributes.name: Elements
attributes.value: Air, Earth, Ether, Fire and Water

metadata.name: Maquette #160
metadata.description:
Like a photography of a city maquette with citizens.

Created in javascript / webGL using three.js and pathtracer.
May - June 2022
@arthurmchr

———
Path tracing is an heavy GPU operation.
Depending on the device, it can takes a few seconds to render.
Worked on Chrome and Firefox.

In live mode :
press S to export a PNG of the rendered image.
press P to pause / resume rendering (automatically paused after 100 rendering steps).
